text.section: In this subtitle, "Commission" means the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission.

section.section: Except as provided in paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection and consistent with the provisions of this title and Title 13 of this article, the Commission shall certify and regulate the operation, ownership, and manufacture of an electronic gaming device authorized under this title.

This section does not apply to:
the ownership or operation of slot machines that are subject to regulation by the Comptroller under § 12-304 of this title; and
paper tip jar gaming where authorized.
This paragraph applies only in Baltimore City and Baltimore County.

If a local law enforcement agency refuses to enforce a provision regarding the legal operation of amusement games, the Commission shall refer the matter to the appropriate office of the State's Attorney.

text.section:
The Commission may determine:
that a county's licensing and regulatory process for electronic gaming devices is equivalent to the State licensing and regulatory process required under this section; and
that a county license for owning, operating, or manufacturing an electronic gaming device in that county is equivalent to a State license.

An electronic gaming device that is not licensed or otherwise operated in compliance with the provisions of this section as of January 1, 2013, is an illegal gaming device that may not legally operate in the State.
